snippet: In New York, Boston and Washington, crowds massed to call attention to the killings of unarmed African-Americans by white police officers.
abstract: Thousands of outraged demonstrators pour into cities across country over grand jury's decision not to indict white New York City police officer whose chokehold caused death of unarmed black man Eric Garner; crowds in New York, Boston, Chicago and elsewhere chant 'I can't breathe,' Garner's last words.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Edna Ishayik and Colin Moynihan from New York, Jess Bidgood from Boston, and Elena Schneider from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In New York, Boston and Washington, crowds massed to call attention to the killings of unarmed African-Americans by white police officers.

headline.main: Protesters Fill Streets Across U.S. Over Decision in Garner Case
headline.print_headline: Across Country, Demonstrators Fill the Streets
